docs.title: GW31 Captains: Salah faces Mane challenge
docs.summary: The Scout says the Liverpool wide men can deliver big armband hauls against Fulham
docs.text:
Liverpool’s key attackers are among the main captaincy favourites in Gameweek 31 of  Fantasy Premier League . 
 The Merseysiders face a  Fulham  side with the worst defensive record in the Premier League, conceding 68 goals. 
 Mohamed Salah  (£13.4m) has been the top armband choice in seven of the last eight Gameweeks. 
 Top captain picks

 *Numbers by the thousands 
 But his 45.3 per cent owners have been disappointed with his recent output. Salah has just one goal and one assist in his last seven appearances. 
 By comparison, his team-mate  Sadio Mane  (£9.9m) visits Craven Cottage in prolific form. 
 Mane's eight goals in the last eight Gameweeks suggests he will pose the main challenge to Salah's dominance of the armband. 
 The Senegalese extended his scoring streak with two goals in the midweek UEFA Champions League win over Bayern Munich. 
 Salah better on the road 
 But, Salah remains  Liverpool ’s most reliable attacker on the road this season. 
 
 
 
 His seven away goals are more than any team-mate and his 47 shots and 24 shots on target on the road rank among the top two players in FPL. 
 Roberto Firmino  (£9.2m) offers another in-form alternative for  Jurgen Klopp 's side.  
 His double against  Burnley  last Sunday means he has seven goals and an assist in his last eight Gameweek starts. 
 Case for Hazard and Higuain 
 Chelsea ’s trip to  Everton  is one of only five matches taking place this weekend. 
 That promotes the appeal of both  Eden Hazard  (£10.9m) and  Gonzalo Higuain  (£9.6m) at Goodison Park. 
 Hazard produced 10 points against  Wolverhampton Wanderers  last weekend, his eighth double-digit haul of the season. 
 And Higuain has impressed since arriving in January. He has recorded 25 shots on goal in the last six Gameweeks, more than any other player. 
 What the experts say  
 Sam Bonfield  ( @FPLFamily ): The Free Hit throws up lots of captain options. Salah,  Callum Wilson  (£6.4m) and Mane are the obvious picks.  Mane ’s form edges it for me. 
 Ben McNair  ( @drbenmcnair ):  It has to be Salah or Mane. It’s even worth considering the Triple Captain chip if you don’t intend to play it in a Double Gameweek. I’m backing  Salah . He’s looked sharp and Fulham may struggle to double-up on him as effectively as some of Liverpool’s recent opponents. 
 Holly Shand  ( @FFCommunity_ ): I have  Salah  as my only Liverpool attacker, so it’s an easy decision.  
 Neal Thurman  ( @nealjthurman ): Hard to see any non-Liverpool options as captain so it's a coin flip between Salah and Mane. 
 Nick and Tom  ( @WGTA_FPL ):  Mane  is my differential captain. He passes the eye test and his underlying statistics in recent matches are impressive. 
 Paul Gee  ( @FplPaulGee ): As the key contender, it will be  Mane  for me. 
 Ben Crabtree  ( @FC_CrabDogg ): Using a Free Hit chip, Wilson looks sensible and  Marko Arnautovic  (£6.8m) could be an unlikely hero. It will be a late, gut-instinct call for me.

docs.title: GW30 Dream Team: Mane outshines Salah
docs.summary: Liverpool star maintains his deadly home form with two-goal haul in win over Burnley
docs.text:
Sadio Mane (£9.9m) continued his prolific scoring spree with two goals and 14 points in Gameweek 30 of  Fantasy Premier League . 
 The  Liverpool  winger has now scored eight goals in the last eight Gameweeks, compared with the three of  Mohamed Salah  (£13.4m). 
 Indeed,  Mane  has now matched or bettered his team-mate's points in each of the last seven Gameweeks. 
 That earns him a place in a  Dream Team that scored 134 points , with six picks coming from teams in the bottom half of the Premier League table. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Bernd Leno (ARS) £4.8m; 9pts 
 Only three sides have recorded fewer clean sheets than  Arsena l's six this season, but the Gunners' goalkeeper now has two shutouts in four Gameweeks. He earned two bonus points from the 2-0 win over  Manchester United . 
 Lee Peltier (CAR) £3.9m; 7pts 
 The  Cardiff City  defender was the pick of the Bluebirds' back line in their 2-0 victory over  West Ham United . His performance brought him a first bonus point of the season. 
 Yan Valery (SOT) £4.0m; 7pts 
 The  Southampton  full-back has now scored in back-to-back Gameweeks and produced returns in the last three. 
 Charlie Daniels (BOU) £4.1m; 7pts 
 A perennial Fantasy favourite completes Gameweek 30's cut-price Dream Team defence. Daniels helped  AFC Bournemouth  to only their third away clean sheet of the campaign in a 2-0 win at  Huddersfield Town . 
 Raheem Sterling (MCI) £11.5m; 21pts 
 His hat-trick in the 3-1 win over  Watford  brought in 21 points, his eighth double-digit return of an increasingly stellar season. That clinched Sterling's sixth appearance in the Dream Team. 
 Sadio Mane (LIV) £9.9m; 14pts 
 The Liverpool midfielder has been in devastating form at home. He found the net twice in Sunday's 4-2 win over  Burnley , having also scored in each of his previous five league matches at Anfield. 
 Ryan Fraser (BOU) £6.2m; 13pts 
 Fraser ended an eight-match barren run with a goal and an assist in AFC Bournemouth's victory over Huddersfield Town. He is the second-most bought player heading into Gameweek 31's reduced schedule. 
 Junior Hoilett (CAR) £5.0m; 11pts 
 The Cardiff midfielder scored his third goal of the campaign, and his first since Gameweek 17, as Neil Warnock's side kept their hopes of avoiding relegation alive. 
 Ayoze Perez (NEW) £6.1m; 16pts 
 Newcastle United 's stunning comeback from two goals down against  Everton  was fuelled by Perez's brace. He also set up the Magpies' opener and boasts three goals and an assist from his last four starts. 
 Jamie Vardy (LEI) £9.0m; 16pts 
 The  Leicester City  striker made it four goals in three Gameweeks with a double in the 3-1 win over  Fulham . He added an assist to earn the maximum bonus-point award and his season-high haul of 16 points. 
 Roberto Firmino (LIV) £9.2m; 13pts 
 Making his first start in four Gameweeks, the Liverpool forward produced two goals and three bonus points. That helped him to a 13-point haul, only his third double-figure return of 2018/19.

 Sadio Mane (£9.6m)

 Mane has scored in four successive Gameweeks for the first time in a single season, finding the net against  Crystal Palace ,  Leicester City ,  West Ham United  and  AFC Bournemouth . 
 His four goals over that period places him joint-top with  Paul Pogba  (£8.8m) among FPL midfielders.

docs.title: Salah and Mane take Liverpool second
docs.summary: Egyptian scores 24th goal of season as Reds overcome Newcastle United 2-0
docs.text:
Goals from Mohamed Salah and Sadio Mane lifted  Liverpool  to second with a 2-0 win over  Newcastle United . 
 Salah broke the deadlock on 40 minutes, Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain playing him in to score for his seventh consecutive match in all competitions. 
 The strike also took Salah level with Harry Kane on 24 goals in the race for the Premier League Golden Boot. 
 Loris Karius kept Liverpool's lead intact, turning Mohamed Diame’s effort wide just before the interval. 
 Mane made it 2-0 on 55 minutes from Roberto Firmino's delightful through-ball. 
 Liverpool move a point above Manchester United, who play Crystal Palace on Monday. 
 Newcastle lie 16th, two points above the relegation zone.
